intro: Spiraea amena var. pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered meadow spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring arching stems covered in small, oval leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, white or pink flowers in early summer, which are borne on slender pedicels. Its foliage turns a striking golden yellow in the fall, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
